info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 9:32PM CDT until May 4 at 11:48PM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana...
Mississippi River At Red River Landing affecting West Feliciana, East Baton Rouge and Pointe Coupee Parishes.
For the Lower Mississippi River...including Red River Landing, Baton Rouge, Donaldsonville, Reserve, New Orleans...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mississippi River at Red River Landing.
* WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to Sunday, May 04.
* IMPACTS...At 58.0 feet, Angola farmland on the left bank becomes inundated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 39.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 46.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Thursday afternoon to a crest of 57.5 feet Wednesday, April 23. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday, May 04. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 145 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY, MAY 04

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge, LA; Pointe Coupee, LA; West Feliciana, LA
